Fruits&Vegitables.description: Fuji apple — a crisp, sweet apple cultivar developed in Japan, prized for eating fresh and in salads.
steps_to_grow: Plant in full sun with good air circulation
Prune annually to shape and remove dead wood
Protect from late frost and pests

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Gala apple — aromatic and sweet, commonly eaten fresh and used in fruit salads.
steps_to_grow: Plant in full sun with fertile soil
Thin fruit to improve size and flavor

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Granny Smith — a tart, firm apple popular for baking, cooking and fresh eating for those who like sour flavors.
steps_to_grow: Prune in winter for shape and vigor

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Cavendish banana — the most common commercial banana variety with creamy texture and sweet flavor.
steps_to_grow: Remove spent leaves and sucker management

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Plantain — a starchy banana variety used for cooking; requires cooking before eating.
steps_to_grow: Harvest when fruit matures but still firm

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Alphonso mango — renowned for its rich, sweet flavor and creamy texture; often called the 'king of mangoes'.
Kent — a juicy, fiberless mango variety with sweet flavor and smooth texture, excellent for fresh use.
steps_to_grow: Plant in full sun with good air circulation

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Navel orange — seedless, sweet citrus ideal for eating fresh and juicing.
Blood orange — noted for its crimson flesh and unique berry-like flavor notes, excellent fresh or in desserts.
benefits: Rich in vitamin C and anthocyanins
steps_to_grow: Plant in full sun in well-drained soil

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Thompson Seedless grapes — sweet, seedless table grapes widely used for fresh eating and raisins.
benefits: Good source of natural sugars and energy
steps_to_grow: Grow on sturdy trellis with full sun
Plant in well-drained soils with good air flow

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Concord grape — aromatic, slightly tart grape variety frequently used for juices, jellies and wines.
steps_to_grow: Plant in full sun and fertile soil
Protect from fungal diseases in humid climates

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Chandler — a large, flavorful strawberry cultivar excellent for fresh sales and short-term processing.
steps_to_grow: Provide full sun and regular irrigation
Mulch to keep fruit clean and conserve moisture
Rotate beds to reduce disease pressure

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Albion — day-neutral strawberry variety producing large, firm fruit with good shelf life.
steps_to_grow: Grow in containers or raised beds with well-drained soil
Harvest regularly to encourage more fruit

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Crimson Sweet watermelon — classic red-fleshed watermelon known for sweet flavor and crisp texture.
benefits: Source of vitamins A and C
steps_to_grow: Plant in warm soil after last frost
Harvest when tendril dries near fruit

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Sugar Baby — small, round watermelon variety with very sweet red flesh, ideal for small gardens.
steps_to_grow: Keep soil consistently moist during growth

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Smooth Cayenne — classic commercial pineapple variety with sweet-tart flavor and firm flesh.
benefits: Good source of vitamin C and manganese
Tropical flavor for variety in diet
steps_to_grow: Plant in well-drained soil with organic matter
Allow long season to mature fruit

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Solo papaya — smaller, sweet papaya variety commonly grown in home gardens and tropical farms.
steps_to_grow: Plant in well-drained soil with full sun
Provide regular watering in dry periods
Protect young plants from strong winds
Harvest when skin begins to soften

Fruits&Vegitables.origin: Iran/Afghanistan region (cultivar widely grown in Mediterranean)
Fruits&Vegitables.description: Wonderful pomegranate — large, juicy arils with deep red color and sweet-tart flavor, popular for juice and fresh eating.
steps_to_grow: Plant in well-drained soil in full sun
Protect from late freezes that damage fruit

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Bartlett pear — sweet, juicy pear often used fresh or canned; smooth texture when ripe.
steps_to_grow: Thin fruit clusters for better size
Prune to shape and remove dead branches

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Bosc pear — firm, sweet pear with distinctive elongated neck and russeted skin; great for baking and poaching.
steps_to_grow: Protect from borers and pear scab

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Bing — sweet cherry variety known for deep red color and rich flavor, popular for fresh eating.
steps_to_grow: Plant in well-drained soil with full sun
Protect from birds and late frost

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Rainier — premium yellow-red cherry variety prized for its sweet, delicate flavor and firm texture.
steps_to_grow: Require cool winters and mild springs
Plant in full sun with good drainage
Thin excess fruit for best quality

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Moorpark apricot — large, sweet apricot variety valued for fresh eating and drying.
steps_to_grow: Plant in full sun and fertile soil
Thin fruits early for larger sizes
Protect from late frost during bloom

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Blenheim — classic apricot variety with firm flesh and sweet-tart flavor, often used for preserves.
steps_to_grow: Choose sunny site with well-drained soil
Prune in summer to reduce disease

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Black Mission fig — sweet, soft fruit with dark purple skin and rich flavor, excellent fresh or dried.
steps_to_grow: Plant in full sun in sheltered location
Prune to maintain size and shape

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Hayward kiwi — large green-fleshed kiwi cultivar with sweet-tart taste, commonly sold worldwide.
steps_to_grow: Train vines on pergolas or trellises
Require male and female plants for pollination

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Hass avocado — creamy-textured avocado variety with rich flavor, commonly used for guacamole and spreads.
steps_to_grow: Protect from frost and strong winds
Allow several years to reach full production

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Allahabad Safeda — popular Indian guava with white flesh and sweet-aromatic flavor.
steps_to_grow: Tolerant of wide range of soils

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Brewster lychee — a widely grown variety with sweet, translucent arils and floral aroma.
steps_to_grow: Provide ample water in dry seasons
Protect flowers and young fruit from cold

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Arctic Jay nectarine — sweet and aromatic stone fruit with smooth skin; a plum-peach hybrid profile.
steps_to_grow: Plant in full sun with good drainage
Thin fruit early for improved size

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Nantes carrot — sweet, crisp root vegetable with cylindrical shape, prized for fresh eating and juicing.
steps_to_grow: Keep soil evenly moist for good root development
Harvest when roots reach desired diameter

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Imperator carrot — long, tapered carrot variety with sweet flavor and smooth texture used widely in markets.
steps_to_grow: Sow in deep, loose soils to allow root elongation
Thin to proper spacing to avoid misshapen roots
Protect from root knot nematodes where prevalent

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Russet potato — starchy tuber ideal for baking, frying and mashing with a fluffy texture when cooked.
steps_to_grow: Plant seed tubers in well-drained soil
Hill soil around stems as plants grow
Provide even moisture while tubers form

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Yukon Gold — versatile potato with yellow flesh and creamy texture, great for roasting and mashing.
steps_to_grow: Ensure full sun and cool nights for tuber quality
Harvest when tubers reach desired size

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Cherry tomato — small, sweet tomato variety ideal for salads and snacking with a concentrated flavor.
benefits: Rich in vitamin C and lycopene
steps_to_grow: Grow in full sun with support or cages
Harvest frequently to encourage more fruit
Protect from cracking by avoiding irregular watering

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Roma (plum) tomato — firm, low-moisture tomato variety favored for sauces, canning and cooking.
steps_to_grow: Provide full sun and fertile soil
Stake or cage to support indeterminate vines

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Yellow onion — versatile cooking onion with a balanced pungency that mellows on cooking.
steps_to_grow: Hill soil around bulbs as they develop
Cure bulbs after harvest for storage

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Red onion — mild and slightly sweet raw, often used in salads and pickles for color and flavor.
steps_to_grow: Plant in full sun in fertile soil
Maintain even moisture during bulb formation
Mulch to conserve moisture and suppress weeds
Cure properly for longer storage life

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Savoy spinach — crinkled-leaf spinach variety appreciated for texture and flavor in cooking.
benefits: Excellent source of iron and calcium
High in vitamins A and C
steps_to_grow: Sow in cool weather with rich soil
Harvest outer leaves to encourage regrowth
Provide partial shade in hot climates

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Green cabbage — hardy leafy vegetable used fresh, fermented or cooked, with dense, crisp heads.
benefits: High in vitamin K and C
Good for gut health when fermented
steps_to_grow: Keep evenly watered for consistent heads

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Snowball cauliflower — compact white curd widely used in a variety of cuisines for its mild flavor.
benefits: Good source of vitamin C and fiber
Can be used as low-carb substitute
steps_to_grow: Plant in cool weather with fertile soil
Keep heads covered for blanched curds if desired
Harvest when curds are compact and before discoloration

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Sugar Pie pumpkin — small, sweet-fleshed pumpkin ideal for pies and baking.
benefits: Tasty in sweet and savory dishes
steps_to_grow: Plant in warm soil after last frost
Harvest when rind hardens and color deepens

Fruits&Vegitables.description: English cucumber — long, thin-skinned cucumber variety with few seeds and mild flavor, often sold wrapped.
steps_to_grow: Train on trellis to save space
Provide even moisture for tender fruit
Protect from cucumber beetles and powdery mildew

Fruits&Vegitables.description: California Wonder — classic sweet bell pepper variety producing blocky, thick-walled fruits ideal for stuffing and cooking.
benefits: Adds color and crunch to dishes
Versatile in raw and cooked recipes
steps_to_grow: Start seedlings indoors and transplant after frost
Provide full sun and fertile soil
Stake plants if fruit load is heavy
Harvest for color and size preference

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Jalapeño — moderately hot chili pepper widely used for salsas, pickling and cooking.
benefits: Contains capsaicin which may aid metabolism
Good source of vitamins A and C
Used in traditional medicine for circulation
steps_to_grow: Use well-drained soil with organic matter
Pinch early flowers to promote vegetative growth if desired
Harvest at green or red stage depending on heat preference

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Sweet corn — tender, sugary corn variety harvested at the milk stage for fresh eating and grilling.
benefits: Good source of antioxidants like lutein
steps_to_grow: Plant in blocks for good pollination
Full sun and rich soil recommended
Harvest at peak sweetness for best flavor

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Garden pea — sweet, tender podded peas typically harvested and eaten fresh or blanched and frozen.
benefits: Good source of plant protein and fiber
Versatile in cooked dishes and salads
steps_to_grow: Plant in cool soils in early spring
Provide trellis or support for vining types
Keep soil moist for pod development
Harvest regularly to encourage more pods

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Romaine lettuce — crisp-leaf lettuce with elongated heads, often used in salads and Caesar dishes.
benefits: Good source of vitamin A and K
steps_to_grow: Sow in cool weather and partial shade in hot climates
Keep evenly moist for tender leaves
Harvest outer leaves or whole heads
Succession sow to maintain continuous harvest

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Calabrese broccoli — classic broccoli type with large heads and tender side shoots, nutritious and versatile.
benefits: High in vitamin C and K
steps_to_grow: Plant in cool weather with fertile soil
Harvest main head early, allow side shoots to develop

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Black Beauty eggplant — large, glossy purple fruit with mild flavor suited for grilling, roasting and stewing.
steps_to_grow: Start indoors and transplant after danger of frost
Full sun and warm growing conditions
Provide steady moisture and fertile soil
Harvest when skin is glossy and seeds are soft

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Strawberries (Rosaceae) are sweet, juicy fruits with high vitamin C content.
Carrots (Apiaceae) are root vegetables rich in beta-carotene and fiber.
Blueberries (Ericaceae) are nutrient-dense berries with strong antioxidant properties.
Broccoli (Brassicaceae) is a green vegetable rich in vitamins, minerals, and fiber.
Tomatoes (Solanaceae) are widely used vegetables/fruit rich in lycopene and vitamins.
Cucumbers (Cucurbitaceae) are refreshing vegetables with high water content.
Bell peppers (Solanaceae) are colorful vegetables high in vitamin C and antioxidants.
Spinach (Amaranthaceae) is a leafy green vegetable rich in iron, vitamins, and antioxidants.
Pineapples (Bromeliaceae) are tropical fruits with a sweet taste and rich in vitamins.
Lettuce (Asteraceae) is a leafy vegetable commonly used in salads and sandwiches.
Apples (Rosaceae) are popular fruits rich in fiber, vitamins, and antioxidants.
Bananas (Musaceae) are tropical fruits high in potassium and natural sugars.
Mangoes (Anacardiaceae) are tropical fruits known for their sweet taste and rich vitamin content.
Onions (Amaryllidaceae) are bulb vegetables widely used for flavor and nutrition.
Garlic (Amaryllidaceae) is a bulb vegetable known for its strong flavor and medicinal properties.
Pears (Rosaceae) are sweet fruits with high fiber and vitamin content.
Peaches (Rosaceae) are juicy, sweet fruits rich in vitamins and antioxidants.
Plums (Rosaceae) are juicy fruits rich in vitamins, fiber, and antioxidants.
Chili peppers (Solanaceae) are spicy vegetables rich in vitamin C and capsaicin.
Zucchinis (Cucurbitaceae) are versatile vegetables rich in vitamins and fiber.
steps_to_grow: Harvest when young for best taste

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Eggplants (Solanaceae) are purple vegetables rich in fiber, vitamins, and antioxidants.
Sweet potatoes (Convolvulaceae) are nutritious root vegetables high in fiber and vitamins.
Avocados (Lauraceae) are creamy fruits high in healthy fats, fiber, and vitamins.
Kiwis (Actinidiaceae) are nutrient-dense fruits rich in vitamin C, fiber, and antioxidants.
Watermelons (Cucurbitaceae) are large, juicy fruits high in water content and vitamins.
Papayas (Caricaceae) are tropical fruits rich in enzymes, vitamins, and antioxidants.
Grapefruits (Rutaceae) are citrus fruits rich in vitamin C and antioxidants.
Pumpkins (Cucurbitaceae) are nutritious vegetables rich in fiber, vitamins, and antioxidants.
Cabbage (Brassicaceae) is a leafy vegetable rich in vitamins, fiber, and antioxidants.
Cauliflower (Brassicaceae) is a versatile vegetable rich in vitamins, fiber, and antioxidants.
Corn (Poaceae) is a widely grown cereal vegetable rich in fiber, vitamins, and minerals.
Radishes (Brassicaceae) are root vegetables rich in fiber and vitamin C.
Cherries (Rosaceae) are sweet, small fruits rich in vitamins and antioxidants.
Strawberries (Rosaceae) are sweet fruits high in vitamin C and antioxidants.
Mushrooms (Agaricaceae) are edible fungi rich in protein, fiber, and vitamins.
steps_to_grow: Plant in a controlled, dark, humid environment
Harvest when caps are fully opened

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Blackberries (Rosaceae) are small, sweet fruits rich in fiber, vitamins, and antioxidants.
Raspberries (Rosaceae) are red fruits rich in vitamins, fiber, and antioxidants.
Brussels sprouts (Brassicaceae) are small leafy vegetables rich in vitamins, fiber, and antioxidants.
Pomegranates (Lythraceae) are nutrient-rich fruits high in antioxidants and vitamins.
Apricots (Rosaceae) are sweet fruits high in vitamins and antioxidants.
Kale (Brassicaceae) is a leafy vegetable rich in vitamins, fiber, and antioxidants.
Beetroots (Amaranthaceae) are root vegetables rich in fiber, vitamins, and antioxidants.
Limes (Rutaceae) are citrus fruits high in vitamin C and antioxidants.
Ginger (Zingiberaceae) is a root vegetable used for flavoring and medicinal purposes.
steps_to_grow: Plant rhizomes in fertile, well-drained soil

Fruits&Vegitables.description: Lychees (Sapindaceae) are tropical fruits rich in vitamin C and antioxidants.
Cantaloupes (Cucurbitaceae) are sweet melons rich in vitamins, fiber, and antioxidants.
Okra (Malvaceae) is a green vegetable rich in fiber, vitamins, and antioxidants.
Persimmons (Ebenaceae) are sweet fruits rich in fiber, vitamins, and antioxidants.
Celery (Apiaceae) is a crunchy vegetable rich in vitamins, fiber, and antioxidants.
Asparagus (Asparagaceae) is a spring vegetable rich in vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants.
